postTranslate.title: Saving the planet could be blockchain’s killer app
postTranslate.leadText: “Putting Paris Agreement carbon markets on Ethereum and connecting the national carbon accounts of the world, is blockchain’s killer app.”

postTranslate.title: Nasdaq reportedly preparing crypto custody services for institutions
postTranslate.leadText: The firm has reportedly created a new group focusing on digital assets and onboarded Ira Auerbach, who previously worked at Gemini, to lead the unit.

postTranslate.title: Can the Metaverse exist without blockchain?
postTranslate.leadText: Read this article to understand why a metaverse can thrive and scale better on blockchain rails.

postTranslate.title: Michael Saylor can’t stop: MicroStrategy now holds 130,000 Bitcoin
postTranslate.leadText: MicroStrategy bought an additional 301 BTC for $6 million at an average price of $19,851, the company’s executive chairman announced on Twitter.

postTranslate.title: Roth IRAs: The ideal long-term cryptocurrency investment?
postTranslate.leadText: Considering investing in cryptocurrencies for the long run? Roth IRAs and other tax advantages investment vehicles are worth considering.

postTranslate.title: Payments platform Fuse integrates ChromePay to bring DID services to Africa
postTranslate.leadText: The African continent has emerged as a hotbed for crypto and blockchain activity, with countries like Nigeria and Ethiopia leading the way.

postTranslate.title: Bitcoin still dominates total payments on BitPay despite the bear market
postTranslate.leadText: Total crypto payments on BitPay remained stable despite the bear market, with monthly transactions surging from around 58,000 in 2021 to 67,000 in 2022.

postTranslate.title: Bitcoin analysts give 3 reasons why BTC price below $20K may be a 'bear trap'
postTranslate.leadText: A set of technical indicators see Bitcoin price ending its prevailing bearish cycle.

postTranslate.title: Enhanced KYC checks can be a win-win for crypto exchanges and consumers — here's why
postTranslate.leadText: Adopting more stringent Know Your Customer (KYC) checks can give crypto exchanges a competitive edge over those that meet minimal standards.

postTranslate.title: Alameda Research ‘happy to return’ $200M loan to Voyager Digital
postTranslate.leadText: The trading company will pay back the debt, which has fallen almost twice in dollar estimate, by the end of September.

postTranslate.title: $160M stolen from crypto market maker Wintermute
postTranslate.leadText: The CEO of Wintermute has stated that it is “open” to treating the hack as a white hat hack and would speak to the attacker.

postTranslate.title: Congress demands crypto payments notification from State Department when helping Ukraine
postTranslate.leadText: The bill amendment demands the Secretary of State submit reports to congressional committees explaining why the State Department made the determination to pay out rewards in cryptocurrency.

postTranslate.title: Intellectual property has an awkward fit in Web3 decentralization — Lawyers
postTranslate.leadText: IP rights will continue to be an area of conflict within Web3 and NFTs, but there’s no easy solution, lawyers told Cointelegraph.

postTranslate.title: Hackers take over CoinDCX Twitter account, promote fake XRP ads
postTranslate.leadText: A hacker took over CoinDCX's official Twitter account and has constantly been tweeting XRP scam links.

postTranslate.title: DeFi platform sees strong interest in halal-approved crypto products
postTranslate.leadText: Navigating crypto is made more difficult for those with religious considerations and the founder of an Islamic law compliant DeFi platform has thousands of users seeking approved cryptocurrencies.

postTranslate.title: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin shares vision for layer-3 protocols
postTranslate.leadText: While layer-2 protocols have been focused on “scalability,” layer-3 protocols would serve a much different purpose, says Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin.

postTranslate.title: Nifty News: The Sandbox hosts its first wedding, Hollywood actor auctions NFT of eye, and more
postTranslate.leadText: Palm Beach gets its own NFT restaurant offering a range of benefits for members, while the PGA partners with Tom Brady-backed NFT platform Autograph.

postTranslate.title: ‘Fed sledgehammer’ will further batter BTC, ETH prices — Bloomberg analyst
postTranslate.leadText: With the Merge resulting in a “buy the rumor, sell the news event,” Mike McGlone thinks that ETH might drop to “$1,000, or even get a bit lower” given how hawkish the Fed has been.

postTranslate.title: Yield Guild Games: Web3 gaming adoption needs a local touch
postTranslate.leadText: YGG’s head of ecosystem development described subDAOs as “sort of its own economy, that has its own treasury and its own token” with its own characteristics depending on the country it’s located in.

postTranslate.title: SEC lawsuit claims jurisdiction because ETH nodes are ‘clustered’ in the US
postTranslate.leadText: The SEC argues that because ETH validators are concentrated more densely in the United States, ETH transactions are seen as taking place in the country.

postTranslate.title: The market isn’t surging anytime soon — so get used to dark times
postTranslate.leadText: Global economic conditions suggest that markets — including the cryptocurrency market — have further downside ahead. Don’t bank on a surge to new all-time highs in the months ahead.

postTranslate.title: P2E gamers, minors not any safer from the tax man — Koinly
postTranslate.leadText: Earning an income from play-to-earns is “complicated” without tax guidance, advises Australian crypto tax specialists.

postTranslate.title: CFTC commissioner visits Ripple offices as decision in SEC case looms
postTranslate.leadText: The outcome of the SEC v. Ripple lawsuit could influence whether the CFTC or SEC will play a greater role in handling the XRP token as a commodity or security.

postTranslate.title: Long the Bitcoin bottom, or watch and wait? BTC traders plan their next move
postTranslate.leadText: Bitcoin price dropped to $18,270, but derivatives traders didn’t flinch. Here is why.

postTranslate.title: White House’s first crypto framework and missed opportunities — Law Decoded, Sept. 12–19
postTranslate.leadText: The industry didn’t take the document well, as the policymakers’ focus on security and enforcement is all too visible.

postTranslate.title: The crypto industry can trust Cynthia Lummis to get regulation right
postTranslate.leadText: The senator has a proven track record when it comes to cryptocurrency and issues such as privacy rights. Her proposal to regulate the industry is one that crypto enthusiasts can get behind.

postTranslate.title: Price analysis 9/19: BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, ADA, SOL, DOGE, DOT, MATIC, SHIB
postTranslate.leadText: Uncertainty over the Federal Reserve’s upcoming rate hike is keeping Bitcoin and altcoins under pressure. This could change if the expected 0.75% bps hike is selected.

postTranslate.title: US Treasury plans to ask public if crypto-related regulations are 'no longer fit for purpose'
postTranslate.leadText: The public has until Nov. 3 to submit comments on the Treasury addressing ransomware attacks, the illicit finance risks of cryptocurrency mixers and DeFi, and coordinating AML/CFT policy.

postTranslate.title: Bitcoin is trapped in a downtrend, but a ‘trifecta of positives’ screams ‘deep value’
postTranslate.leadText: In a recent Twitter Space, Capriole Fund founder Charles Edwards told Cointelegraph that BTC could go lower, but currently reflects “incredible deep value” based on multiple price metrics.

postTranslate.title: Russian official says bill will give businesses leeway in use of crypto internationally
postTranslate.leadText: Finance Ministry official says an upcoming bill may provide local infrastructure and allow businesses to negotiate the use of cryptocurrencies in international trade on their own.
